data.title: German Authority Opens Probe Into Amazon, Apple Over Alleged Anticompetition
data.text: German antitrust regulators are investigating both Amazon and Apple over possible anticompetitive behavior in the country, according to German Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, quoted by Reuters. Germany is looking into whether Amazon is allowed to ban some third-party competitors from offering certain branded products on its eCommerce site, Reuters reported.

data.title: Here's how tech's most valuable companies have performed under Trump
data.text: Tech's five biggest companies all report earnings this week, giving investors one last look at results before next week's election.

data.title: Tech giants lost more than $270 billion in market value in the last two days
data.text: Big Tech companies lost a collective $273 billion in value over the past two days, as the broader market sank due to a global surge in Covid-19 cases.

data.title: 7 AI Stocks to Buy as Automation Advances
data.text: AI stocks are moving to the forefront of investors' attention. In many cases, they may not realize how many companies are already on board.

data.title: Economic cost of new EU tech rules could top $100.5 billion, study says
data.text: The European Union's plan to rein in U.S. tech giants with new rules could cost the 27-country bloc as much as 85 billion euros ($100.5 billion) in economic growth, Brussels-based think tank ECIPE warned.

data.title: Amazon launches first online store in the Nordics, gets off to rocky start
data.text: The launch got off to a rocky start with Amazon using the wrong flag for Sweden and mistranslating product descriptions.

data.title: Amazon Already Dominates This Market. And It's Still Gaining Share.
data.text: Sales are accelerating for this high-margin business.

data.title: Better Buy: Amazon.com vs. Walmart
data.text: Which retail juggernaut is a better long-term investment?

data.title: Amazon's prep for holiday sales rush, pandemic in focus
data.text: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday will announce its latest financial results, and Wall Street wants to know if it can keep up with shoppers' heightened demand during the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: New Amazon Web Services Offering Could Reduce Vehicle Software-Related Recalls
data.text: Software-related vehicle recalls is a growing issue as cars and trucks become more technically complex. But many of those recalls may be avoided after Amazon Web Services announced new technology addressing that issue will be available on its platform.

data.title: Amazon Delivers New eCommerce Site To Sweden Along With Eco-Friendly Power Grid
data.text: Amazon is advancing its presence in Sweden with a new eCommerce site and a clean energy grid to support the tech giant's data centers, according to company statement on Wednesday (Oct. 28).  The 91-megawatt power project Amazon is building in Sweden will likely deliver approximately 280,000-megawatt hours of clean energy to the Swedish grid.

data.title: Is Antitrust a Bigger Risk Than COVID-19 For Amazon Stock?
data.text: Investors should be aware of, but not panic about, the recent regulatory scrutiny of Amazon.

data.title: Got $2,000? 3 Buffett Stocks That Are Screaming Buys
data.text: The Oracle of Omaha has a knack for picking out long-term winners.

data.title: Hej! Amazon opens Amazon.se in Sweden to expand in Europe
data.text: Amazon is the biggest online retailer in Europe, and today it took the next step in making that effort more localized. The company has launched a dedicated portal for Sweden at Amazon.se — giving Swedish shoppers, third-party merchants, and itself, a local URL — and a local logistics system, and a local marketing push — […]

data.title: Amazon Sweden Is Finally Open For Business
data.text: Small Nordic retailers are bracing themselves for an uncertain future as Amazon Sweden opens for business. It could be the first step in a Nordic retail empire.
